meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji 休 means <kanji>rest</kanji>, so what's the verb version of that? It's <vocabulary>to rest</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to take time off</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You need <vocabulary>to rest</vocabulary>, right? Don't just answer with a "yes," this deserves a "<reading>YAASS</reading>" (やす)! YAAASSS let's RESSST!!!
